info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 11:15AM EDT until May 01 at 8:37AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Blacksburg VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Halifax and Charlotte Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Water is several feet deep on portions of River Road and Black Walnut Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to a crest of 25.3 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.3 feet on 05/26/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Roanoke (Staunton) River Randolph 24.0 9.1 Fri 10 am ED 19.3 25.1 20.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EDT.
